name: Holy Water
description: Water blessed by a priest; used for blessings, protection, and recalling Baptism.

name: Blessed Salt
description: Salt blessed by a priest; sometimes used with holy water in certain blessings.

name: Blessed Oil
description: Oil blessed for use in certain devotional practices and blessings.

name: Ashes (Ash Wednesday)
description: Blessed ashes placed on the forehead as a sign of repentance at the start of Lent.

name: Incense
description: Fragrant resin burned as a sign of reverence; symbolizes prayer rising to God.

name: Rosary
description: Prayer beads to meditate on the Mysteries of Christ and Our Lady.

name: Bible
description: The Sacred Scriptures; lectio divina and prayerful reading are powerful devotions.

name: Scapular
description: A devotional garment signifying dedication and a call to Christian living.

name: Miraculous Medal
description: A medal of the Blessed Virgin Mary associated with St. Catherine Labouré.

name: St. Benedict Medal
description: A medal invoking the protection and intercession of St. Benedict.

name: Palm (Palm Sunday)
description: Blessed palm branches kept as a sign of Christ’s victory.

name: Votive Candle
description: A blessed candle lit as a sign of ongoing prayer and devotion.

name: Processional Cross
description: Cross carried in processions; a sign of Christ’s saving Passion.

name: Altar
description: A consecrated table for the Eucharistic sacrifice; focal point of the church.

name: Agnus Dei (Wax)
description: A blessed wax disk with the Lamb of God motif; devotional sacramental.

name: Holy Card
description: Small devotional image with prayers or saints, used for meditation and inspiration.
